template

Class GridTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • template.GridTemplate
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Grid

    public abstract class GridTemplate
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GridTemplate()
      Construct an empty 2D array with some default dimensions.
      GridTemplate(int row, int col, java.lang.String filename)
      Construct an empty 2D array with dimensions width and height, then fill it with data from the file filename.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GridTemplate

        public GridTemplate()
        Construct an empty 2D array with some default dimensions.

      • GridTemplate

        public GridTemplate(int row,
                    int col,
                    java.lang.String filename)
        Construct an empty 2D array with dimensions width and height, then fill it with data from the file filename.
        Parameters:
        row - The number of rows on the grid.
        col - The number of columns on the grid.
        filename - The text file to read from.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Code a toString() method that nicely prints the grid to the commandline.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet marker,
                 float x,
                 float y,
                 float width,
                 float height)
        (Graphical UI) Draws the grid on a PApplet. The specific way the grid is depicted is up to the coder.
        Parameters:
        marker - The PApplet used for drawing.
        x - The x pixel coordinate of the upper left corner of the grid drawing.
        y - The y pixel coordinate of the upper left corner of the grid drawing.
        width - The pixel width of the grid drawing.
        height - The pixel height of the grid drawing.

      • clickToIndex

        public java.awt.Point clickToIndex(java.awt.Point p,
                                   float x,
                                   float y,
                                   float width,
                                   float height)
        (Graphical UI) Determines which element of the grid matches with a particular pixel coordinate. This supports interaction with the grid using mouse clicks in the window.
        Parameters:
        p - A Point object containing a graphical pixel coordinate.
        x - The x pixel coordinate of the upper left corner of the grid drawing.
        y - The y pixel coordinate of the upper left corner of the grid drawing.
        width - The pixel width of the grid drawing.
        height - The pixel height of the grid drawing.
        Returns:
        A Point object representing a coordinate within the grid, or null if the pixel coordinate falls completely outside of the grid.

      • readData

        public void readData(java.lang.String filename,
                     char[][] gameData)
        Reads the data from a txt file and copies it down to gameData.
        Parameters:
        filename - the file name of the txt file being read.
        gameData - the grid that the txt file is being copied to.
